text: Tap @ Oberphalzer hof. Pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma of bready malts, light grassy, notes of honey, spicey/herbal touch with some light minerals. Taster is well rounded between flavours, loads of hops and bready malts, super smooth and soft, light bitternes, rather fruity.

Sampled at the Oberpfälzer Hof, Windischeschenbach as the hous Zoigl.
Small but lasting beighe head.Opque amber color. Very nice malty aroma from pils and light roasted malts. Mild and tasty with a small bitterness.

My Bottom Line:
Orangey hops and honeyed malts combine over notes of toasted bread crust in this personable Zoiglbier.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the hazy golden amber.
-Carbonation is soft, which makes the mouthfeel appear rounder, smoother.
-Drinkability is optimal.
-The finish is just bitter enough to keep things interesting on the second pint.

On tap at Oberfpalzer Hof.
On tap at Oberpfalzer Hotel Windischeschenbach. Hazy amber colour lasting white head. Some hop some malt on the aroma. Some fullness in the mouth. Light hop on the finish. Fine.

Draft at  Oberpfalzer Hof Windisch. (2009-2012) and Beim Heigl in Schirmitz (2014). Mostly clear orange-amber with a white foamy head. Aroma is fruity / juicy with notes of orange jelly. Malt is pound cake, yeast is slightly chalky. Medium body, carbonation is sharp and pointed, finish is short. More sweet than bitter. In decent shape at both Heigl and the Oberpfalzer Hof (who pours this as their own). (3.5)

Bayrischer anstich at Binner Windischeschenbach, November 2015. Hazed honey gold with a short white head. Bright, clean, and hoppy (for Windisch.); toasted grain, nuts, pastries, apricot, dried herbs from the aroma hops.; malt sugar has that wonderful honey-glazed pastry effect, and in the mouth its minerally, snappy, and crisp. (3.7)

Draughts@Oberpfälzer Hof, W-bach 10/2015. "Batches brewed together with Binner". Amber-russet pour - the deeper orange variety that sets W-Bach apart from their greenyellow neighbours/rivals in Neuhaus. - Flowery, then fruity malt aromatics ("lieblich"), opening up to drier Sahnekaramell aka Werthers Echte joined by chalky, near-mineral notes. Wonderful, moreish blend more butterscotch Munich malts and wood-herbal hop notes, buttered bread, a late leafy hop bitterness to round things off. Somewhere in between all that: watery pockets. Quality roast, finishing on buttered breadcrust.

Frühschoppen beim Binner, 22.5.2015. - Schönes Braungelb, leicht trüb; gekrönt von einem Berg sahnig-lockeren Schaums. - Schöne hopfenwürzig-herbe, zart rauchige Nase, nur leichte Fruchtigkeit (Orangenschale). - Im Antrunk zarte Karamelsüße und angenehm herber Hopfen, perfekt aufeinander abgestimmt. Schwach rezent, schlank und weich im Mund, geht runter wie Öl. Im Abgang schön trockene, nicht besonders fruchtige aber hopfenherbe Bittere, zart rauchig. Sehr langer bitterer Nachtrunk. - Ausgezeichneter Zoigl, schön hopfenherb und etwas hopfenwürziger als die anderen. Woher wohl die rauchige Note kommt? Hier wurde doch gewiß kein Rauchmalz verwendet ...

Draught at Beim Heigl in Schirmitz: Hazed orange with golden highlights. Creamy and sticky halo of foam. Bright and clean aroma of orange marmalade, flowers, lemon, pecan, minerals and piecrust. Lush carbonation. Soft, refined malt links up with a lustrous and succulent orangey fruitiness, initially. Harmonious interplay of expressive flower nectar and an edgeless base of pils malt, which mimics new-mown hay. Multilayered maltiness spawns deep cookie, toasted bread, and softer toffee kisses. Juicy melanoidins shyly lurk amid silky, lip-smacking Cara-malt sugars. Appetizing contrast of explosive fruitiness and scratchy minerals blend with an invigorating splash of lemony acids. Pervasive fruitiness flourishes atop the lean malt and clean attenuation. Rustic yeast notes enrich the deep toast and lush hay with notable dustiness in the cohesive finish. Another delightful zoiglbier that doesnt try to wow you with grandiosity or pretentiousness, as singular and well-crafted as it is. Fruity, balanced, minerally, good malt detail, and overall just lovely.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: (draught) murky deep golden colour with a creamy light-beige head. aroma of light bubble gum and floral hops, slightly meaty, with some traces of pale malts and yeast. flavour is mostly herbal hops and grainy pale malts, with a hint of liquorice, some more yeast and a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2015 very drinkable, bitter, medium-full body.
soft carbonation.
you can drink 6 of this with no problem.
Tap @ Oberphalzer Hof. Pours cloudy golden with a creamy head. Grass, dough, mild lemon and yeast. Crisp, dry and overly delcious. Yes!!!
Hazy goldenwith a small white head.Malty aroma of biscuit, bread and grainwith herbal hops and a hint of fruit. Dry and light maltyflavour well hopped with a good bitterness

draught at Oberpfälzer Hof. Hazy orange-golden colour, big off-white head. Full-bodied, grainy malt flavours, lovely resiny-grassy hop flavours with a touch of lemon. Smooth palate. The perfect Zoigl - delicious!

on tap at oberpfaelzerhof, pre-zoigltag in neuhaus 2010, after being cruely denied in 2009 by them closing a few minutes before our arrival. anyways, far from the best zoigl - a bit too simple with some imperfections showing; suggestions of asparagus and lactic sourness, with a muted character of pear and passionfruit and lightly chalky aroma. not a bad beer really, but up against some pretty stiff local competition
Süßlicher und süffiger Antrunk mit leicht herben noten. Leider wössrig werdend, die Getreidigkeit kann dies aber wieder egalisieren. Nicht sehr tiefgründig aber sehr erfrischend. 10/9/10/9//10
Hazy orange with a large off white head. First pour after the siesta. Aroma had malt, vegs and and hints of hops. Fairly dry flavour with floral hops, malt and vegs. Finished dry and somewhat bitter.

Draught at the Oberpfälzer Hof: Golden, hazy, lasting medium-sized white foam; relatively dry  distinctive hoppy and yeasty nose; light to medium bodied; moderate dry bitter-sweet flavour; distinctive hops in the fruity and yeasty finish. Moreish.......
Tap at Oberpfälzer Hof.  Yeast and lemon malt aroma.  Golden yellow color with moderate head.  Slightly sweet barley malt and dry lemon flavor.  Nicely blended.  Subdued but very nice.

Draugh at Oberpfälzer Hof, Windischeschenbach.  Hazy pale amber, rich creamy head. Grassy nose. Dry despite underlying malt sweetness with soft mouthfeel and light-medium body. Lightly minerally with complimentary grassy hops and lingering bitterness. tasty and hugely refreshing. Perfect in its simplicity!

Light haze.  Amber-straw colour.  Thick, collapsing head.  Yeasty aroma with herbal hop.  Fizziest zoigl of the day, with a maltier accent.  More minerally in character than the others, which I did not favor, but that may have been the way it came across the palate given the extra carbonation.  A bit thin.

At the hotel/stube. Bright orange-gold with big lasting white fluffy head, lacing, and lots of rising bubbles. Aroma is bakery fresh bread, dough, and has a nice sweetness to it. Palate is grainy and relatively high carbonation for a Zoigl. Has a nice husky but hoppy bitterness in the finish. Very much a bread crust and toast flavor, more so than the color would suggest. Great yeasty finish.
Draught at the hotel. Cloudy orange colour. Small white head. The flavour is OK malty, low bitterness. Hint of fruit.

A Mes rate: Gravity serving at Zeitgeist.Cloudy orange amber with a thin white head and lots of lace. Wheaty, creamy malt, some tobacco and slight hops. Slight sour notes point to this not being in the best condition. Reasonable malt and hop balance. Fruity finish with some tangy hops. and a little dryness right at the back of the palate.

At Oberpfaelzer Hof, Windischeschenbach.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy dark yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly hoppy (flowers), lightly yeasty (cobwebs, basement), with a note of cantaloupe rind, hint of honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

One of the more malty renditions I sampled (I wrote "liquid bread" in the margin of my review sheet).  Not terribly distinctive otherwise, but a great quaffer as usual.Earlier Rating: 12/2/2007 Total Score: 3.5At Beim Binner, Windischeschenbach.

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy dark yellow to light amber.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain/bread), trace hops (flowers), lightly yeasty (basement), with a light note of honeydew melon, hint of honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Marvelous atmosphere here...a home, basically, so youre sitting in their living room at communal tables.  The beer doesnt separate itself from other zoigls too much, but as usual its a great quaffer and would be easy to drink liter upon liter of.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2009 Tap @ hotel. Golden color, slightly hazy. Lovely flowery, buttery aroma. Malty, flowery hopbitter flavor with hints of flour, orange and butter, lingering on in the long aftertaste, along with a touch of bakers yeast and chewing gum. Good!

A sample in oktober 2009 confirmed the quality of this beer.
